A pioneer in the national sport, Santos FC became, in early 2006, the first football club in Brazil to become a paralympic club. Since then, through a partnership with the Lar das MoÃ§as Cegas de Santos (LMC), Santos has Goalball, with male and female teams, as one of its modalities. The sport, which kept the LMC since 1999, is growing in popularity. In recent games, including the Brazilian national team has featured players from Santos. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{pt icon}} [http://www.santosfc.com.br Official website] {{Santos FC}} {{Use mdy dates|date=March 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Santos Futebol Clube Karate}} [[Category:Sports clubs established in 1912]] [[Category:Brazilian karate clubs]] [[Category:Santos Futebol Clube]]
